page.title: 10Rescue Services
page.content: {Coastguard Service-}This is an auxillary service and 20 men are responsible for safety at sea along the coast from St.Catherine's Lighthouse to Atherfield.In emergencies they co-ordinate the following services-{1 Air Sea Rescue}- the helicopters from{Lee-on-Solent} take approx 11mins to reach this stretch of coast.{2 Yarmouth Lifeboat} - which takes approx 18mins to be in operation here.100yrs ago there were 7 full time coastguards but from 1975 it has been an auxillary service.When there is an emergency the man on duty at{The Needles}phones one auxillary member who then phones another and in this way the message is passed on. Bleepers similar to those used by the Fire Service will be introduced in the near future.
